relation: Shut down WebLogic Server middle tier
Start Oracle SES server, WebLogic Server middle tier, and Oracle Database server
Stop Oracle SES server, WebLogic Server middle tier, and Oracle Database server
Restart Oracle SES server, WebLogic Server middle tier, and Oracle Database server
pageTitle: Oracle® Secure Enterprise Search Installation and Upgrade Guide
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {18067=Installing Oracle SES on a Port Number less than 1024, 20429=April 2015, 12512=Oracle SES support for Oracle Database 11.2.0.3.x ends in August 2015, so you must upgrade to Oracle Database 11.2.0.4.0 before the support ends for Oracle Database 11.2.0.3.x. Refer to the Oracle SES Release Notes section "Mandatory Upgrade to Oracle Database 11.2.0.4.0" for the steps to upgrade from Oracle Database 11.2.0.3.x to Oracle Database 11.2.0.4.0.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {7347=The following is a sample output displayed by running this command on an Oracle Linux 5 system. It shows the kernel version of 2.6.18 and the errata level of -128.el5PAE., 66704=Here, port can be any free port greater than 1024., 209290=Copyright © 2006, 2015, Oracle and/or its affiliates. Oracle Support Services include phone assistance, version updates, and access to our service offerings. You have access to phone support 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. In the U.S.A., you can call Product Support at 1-800-223-1711., 75386=Oracle Fusion Middleware Repository Creation Utility User's Guide at http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E23943_01/doc.1111/e14259/rcu.htm#RCUUG113 for detailed information about creating database schema using RCU, 31686=After the installation is complete, follow the instructions in "(Optional) Changing the Oracle SES Middle Tier Port" to change the port to a number less than 1024., 143644=Apply the Database Patches 8353098 and 9581727 for Oracle SES 11.1.2.2 Instance, 92076=Oracle Fusion Middleware Securing Oracle WebLogic Server guide at http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E23943_01/web.1111/e13707/atn.htm#SECMG175 for information about configuring an LDAP-based identity store as WebLogic Server authentication provider., 31204=On Linux and UNIX systems, only root users can bind to ports less than 1024. Since Oracle SES must be installed by a non-root user, you must install Oracle SES on port 1024 or higher and then change it later., 152290=Download the Oracle Database 11.1.0.7.0 patches 8353098 and 9581727 from My Oracle Support Web site https://support.oracle.com and apply them over the Oracle SES 11.1.2.2 database instance., 6567=2.6.32-100.0.19 or later, 92483=Oracle Fusion Middleware Application Security Guide at http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E23943_01/core.1111/e10043/cfgauthr.htm#JISEC2291 for information about configuring an LDAP-based or a DB-based OPSS security store., 52834=Its default value is the first available port starting 5720. You can specify any other available port. The specified port must be within a valid range, for example, for Linux and UNIX systems, it must be within the range of 1024 to 65535., 150689=This step is necessary only if the Oracle SES instance that you are upgrading is bound to a port number less than 1024. You must change the port to a number greater than or equal to 1024 before starting the upgrade. After the upgrade completes, you can change the port back to a number less than 1024. Follow the instructions in "(Optional) Changing the Oracle SES Middle Tier Port" of this document., 6454=2.6.18 or later, 12775=32000, 7061=2.6.16.21 or later, 6791=2.6.32 or later, 52217=WLS Admin Port: The WebLogic Server administration port. Its default value is the first available port starting 7001. You can specify any other available port. The specified port must be within a valid range, for example, for Linux and UNIX systems, it must be within the range of 1024 to 65535., 34602=Patches for Oracle Database 11.2.0.4.x: 20882647, 13073613, and 19249319. Apply these patches using Oracle OPatch utility., 34296=Patches for Oracle Database 11.2.0.3.x: 13404129, 12985184, 14256211, 13366199, 19049016, 12401111, 16059292, 16272008, 12919564, and 18997672. If the existing database is an Oracle RAC Database, then apply the additional patches 16921832 and 13387392., 7150=2.6.27.19 or later, 57925=Oracle SES supports installing Patch Set Updates (PSUs) for Oracle Database base releases 11.2.0.3.0 and 11.2.0.4.0, as long as the set of mandatory Oracle Database patches listed on the Oracle support website is adhered to. For example, you can install PSU 11.2.0.3.11 over the Oracle Database base release 11.2.0.3.0 only and PSU 11.2.0.4.3 over the Oracle Database base release 11.2.0.4.0 only. For more information about installing PSUs, refer to the section "Applying Critical Patch Updates (CPUs) and Patch Set Updates (PSUs)"., 165423=Set the DBFDIR environment variable to the absolute path of the directory containing the DBF files. For example, if the DBF files are in the directory /scratch/aime/ses11222/oradata, then run the following command:, 170474=Set the SES_HOME environment variable to the absolute path of the SES home directory. For example, if the SES home directory absolute path is /scratch/aime/ses11222/middlware_home/Oracle_SES1, then run the following command:, 72846=If you want to use WebLogic Server in a clustered environment, then refer to the support note 1611280.1 "Implementing High Availability for Oracle SES 11.2.2.2". You can search for this support note on My Oracle Support Web site https://support.oracle.com by entering the string 1611280.1 in the Global Search field., 31592=During installation, specify a port greater than or equal to 1024., 57276=For example, Oracle Database's default settings for maximum sessions and maximum processes are 247 and 150 respectively, which are not adequate to allocate database connections when more servers come online. To resolve this issue, you need to increase the values for both these settings to around 1000., 6961=2.6.32-71.el6.x86_64 or later, 143412=(Optional) Change the Search Service HTTP Port if less than 1024, 123324=If needed, you can change the Oracle SES middle tier port as described in this section. There are two methods to change the Search HTTP port, depending upon whether the port that you want to change to is greater than or equal to 1024, or is less than 1024., 124429=To change the Search HTTP port to a value less than 1024, execute the following additional steps after executing the above mentioned steps: }
textBeforeTable: You can use the following WebLogic Server scripts to start and stop the Oracle SES middle tier components (WebLogic Server, Oracle ESS Server, and Oracle SES Server): Using WebLogic Server Scripts You can start and stop the Oracle SES middle tier components (WebLogic Server, Oracle ESS Server, and Oracle SES Server) using the WebLogic Administration Console. Using WebLogic Administration Console Using searchctl Command Using WebLogic Server Scripts Using WebLogic Administration Console You can start and stop the Oracle SES instance (Oracle SES server, Oracle ESS server, WebLogic server, and Oracle Database server) using any of the following methods: Starting and Stopping Oracle SES Instance If you have configured Oracle Single Sign-On (SSO) for Oracle SES 11.1.2.2, then after upgrading to Oracle SES 11.2.2.2, you must manually reconfigure SSO for Oracle SES 11.2.2.2. You can configure SSO using the WebLogic Server Administration Console. Refer to the section "Configuring Secure Search with OracleAS Single Sign-On" of Oracle Secure Enterprise Search Administrator's Guide for the steps to configure SSO for Oracle SES. (Optional) Configuring Oracle Single Sign-On for Oracle SES
textAfterTable: searchctl start Start Oracle SES server searchctl stop Shut down Oracle SES server searchctl restart Restart Oracle SES server searchctl start_midtier Start WebLogic Server middle tier searchctl stop_midtier Shut down WebLogic Server middle tier searchctl restart_midtier Restart WebLogic Server middle tier searchctl start_backend Start Oracle Database server searchctl stop_backend Shut down Oracle Database server searchctl restart_backend Restart Oracle Database server searchctl startall Start Oracle SES server, WebLogic Server middle tier, and Oracle Database server searchctl stopall Stop Oracle SES server, WebLogic Server middle tier, and Oracle Database server searchctl restartall Restart Oracle SES server, WebLogic Server middle tier, and Oracle Database server Note: You must provide the Oracle SES administrator password when running the searchctl
